meanings.definition: A system of government in which one person has absolute power.
meanings.sent1: In an autocracy, the leader makes all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The autocracy in that country limits the freedom of its citizens.
meanings.sent3: The classroom became an autocracy when the teacher declared no more recess.
meanings.sent4: Her control over the company was an autocracy, with no room for dissent.
meanings.sent5: The autocracy of the king was felt by all who dared to oppose him.

meanings.definition: The rule or power of an autocrat.
meanings.sent1: The autocracy of the king was unquestioned by his subjects.
meanings.sent2: The autocracy of the ruler was evident in every decision made.
meanings.sent3: The autocracy of the cat over the house was comically portrayed in the movie.
meanings.sent4: Her autocracy over the office was compared to that of a strict parent.
meanings.sent5: The autocracy of the CEO was felt by all employees in the company.

meanings.sent1: The autocracy of the dictator led to oppression of the people.
meanings.sent2: The autocracy of the manager made it difficult for employees to voice their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The autocracy of the toddler over the toys caused chaos in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: His autocracy over the team was like a shield against any outside interference.
meanings.sent5: The autocracy of the queen was unmatched, and her word was law.
